metadata.Name: MMLU-Pro
metadata.Description: MMLU-Pro is a more robust and challenging version of the MMLU benchmark. It was created by identifying and reformulating ambiguous questions from the original MMLU test set using a combination of GPT-4 and manual curation to require deeper knowledge and reasoning.
Provider: Gwangju Institute of Science and Technology
metadata.Paper Title: MMLU-Pro: A More Robust and Challenging Multi-Task Language Understanding Benchmark
Affiliations: Gwangju Institute of Science and Technology
metadata.Abstract: Large Language Models (LLMs) have demonstrated remarkable capabilities in various natural language understanding tasks. However, their performance on complex reasoning tasks remains a challenge. The Massive Multitask Language Understanding (MMLU) benchmark has been widely used to evaluate the knowledge and reasoning abilities of LLMs. In this paper, we introduce MMLU-Pro, a more robust and challenging version of the MMLU benchmark. We identify and reformulate ambiguous questions from the original MMLU test set, resulting in a new benchmark that requires deeper knowledge and reasoning. Our experiments show that MMLU-Pro is more challenging for current state-of-the-art LLMs, with an average performance drop of over 10% compared to the original MMLU. We believe that MMLU-Pro will serve as a valuable resource for the community to develop and evaluate more capable LLMs. The dataset and code are available at https://github.com/GAIR-NLP/MMLU-Pro.
